201.description: The assistant has been successfully created.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order by the created_at timestamp of the objects. asc for ascending order and desc for descending order.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. after is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. before is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include before=obj_foo in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

get.description: Retrieves a specific assistant defined by an assistant's `id`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the assistant.

delete.description: Deletes a specific assistant defined by an assistant's `id`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the assistant.

200.description: The assistant has been successfully deleted.

post.description:
Creates a model response for the given conversation. The following parameters are not working for the `TensorRT-LLM` engine:
- `frequency_penalty`
- `presence_penalty`
- `top_p`
Pull a model from a remote source.

delete.description: Stops the download of a model with the corresponding taskId provided in the request body

taskId.description: The unique identifier of the download task to be stopped

get.description: Lists the currently available models, and provides basic information about each one such as the owner and availability. [Equivalent to OpenAI's list model](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/models/list).

200.description: The model has been successfully started.
The model has been successfully started.

get.description: Retrieves a model instance, providing basic information about the model such as the owner and permissions. [Equivalent to OpenAI's list model](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/models/retrieve).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the model.

delete.description: Deletes a model. [Equivalent to OpenAI's delete model](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/models/delete).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the model.

200.description: The model has been successfully deleted.

patch.description: Updates a model instance defined by a model's `id`.

200.description: The model has been successfully updated.

post.description: Imports a model from a specified path.

get.description: Lists all the available threads along with its configurations.

200.description: The message object matching the specified ID.

get.description: Returns a list of messages for a given thread.

post.description: Deletes all messages in a thread.

200.description: The thread has been successfully updated.

delete.description: Deletes a specific thread defined by a thread `id` .

200.description: The thread has been successfully deleted.

delete.description: Stops the Cortex API endpoint server for the detached mode.

get.description: Retrieves the health status of your Cortex's system.
Retrieves all the available model statuses within Cortex.
Retrieves the resources status of the system.
Lists the currently available local engines.
Retrieves an engine instance, providing basic information about the engine.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the engine.

post.description: Install an engine with the given name. It will download the engine if it is not available locally.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the engine.

delete.description: Uninstall an installed engine with the given name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the engine.

info.title: Cortex API
info.description: Cortex API enables API commands for seamless interaction with LLMs.

tags.name: Inference
tags.description: This endpoint initiates interaction with a Large Language Models (LLM).

tags.name: Assistants
tags.description: These endpoints manage the lifecycle of an Assistant within a conversation thread.

tags.name: Models
tags.description: These endpoints provide a list and descriptions of all available models within the Cortex framework.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: These endpoints manage the retrieval and storage of conversation content, including responses from LLMs and other metadata related to chat interactions.

tags.name: Threads
tags.description: These endpoints handle the creation, retrieval, updating, and deletion of conversation threads.

tags.name: Engines
tags.description: Endpoints for managing the available engines within Cortex.

tags.name: System
tags.description: Endpoints for stopping the Cortex API server, checking its status, and fetching system events.

id.description: The unique identifier of the assistant.

description.example: A default assistant that can use all downloaded models
description.default: A default assistant that can use all downloaded models

tools.description: The tools associated with the assistant.

id.description: The identifier of the assistant that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a assistant.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the assistant was successfully deleted.

content.description: The Content of the chat message.

role.description: The role of the entity in the chat completion.

messages.description: Array of chat messages to be used for generating the chat completion.

model.description: The unique identifier of the model.

stream.description: Determines the format for output generation. If set to `true`, the output is generated continuously, allowing for real-time streaming of responses. If set to `false`, the output is delivered in a single JSON file.

max_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases that signal the model to stop producing further output.

frequency_penalty.description: Modifies the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases within a single output.

presence_penalty.description: Reduces the likelihood of repeating tokens, promoting novelty in the output.

temperature.description: Influences the randomness of the model's output.

top_p.description: Sets probability threshold for more relevant outputs.

content.description: The textual content of the chat message or completion generated by the model.

role.description: The role of the participant in the chat, such as 'user' or 'system', indicating who is the sender of the message.

finish_reason.description: The reason the chat completion ended, typically indicating whether the model completed the text naturally or was cut off.

index.description: The index of the completion relative to other generated completions, useful for identifying its order in a batch request.

message.description: An object representing the message details involved in the chat completion, encapsulated within a MessageDto.

completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens used in the completion part of the response generated by the model.

prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens used in the prompt part of the chat input, which is provided to the model.

total_tokens.description: The total number of tokens used in both the prompt and the completion, summarizing the entire token count of the chat operation.

choices.description: A list of choices generated by the chat model.

created.description: The timestamp of when the chat completion was created, expressed as a Unix timestamp.

id.description: The unique identifier for the chat completion.

model.description: The identifier of the model used to generate the chat completion.

object.description: The type of object, typically set to 'chat_completion' to denote the nature of the API response.

system_fingerprint.description: A unique fingerprint that identifies the system configuration used during the chat completion.

usage.description: An object representing the usage statistics of the model for the current completion.

model.description: The name of the embedding model to be used.

input.description: The text or token array(s) to be embedded. This can be a single string, an array of strings, or an array of token arrays to embed multiple inputs in one request.

encoding_format.description: Specifies the format for the embeddings. Supported formats include `float` and `int`. This field is optional.

dimensions.description: Defines the number of dimensions for the output embeddings. This feature is supported by certain models only. This field is optional.

model.description: Identifier of the model utilized for generating embeddings.

embedding.description: The embedding vector represented as an array of floating-point numbers.

usage.description: Details of token usage, including prompt_tokens and total_tokens.

model.description: The identifier or URL of the model to use. It can be a model ID on Cortexso (https://huggingface.co/cortexso) or a HuggingFace URL pointing to the model file. For example: 'gpt2' or 'https://huggingface.co/TheBloke/Mistral-7B-Instruct-v0.1-GGUF/blob/main/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.1.Q2_K.gguf'

id.description: The id which will be used to register the model.

name.description: The name which will be used to overwrite the model name.

model.description: The unique identifier of the model.

files.description: The URL sources from which the model downloaded or accessed.

prompt_template.description: A predefined text or framework that guides the AI model's response generation.
prompt_template.example: You are an expert in {subject}. Provide a detailed and thorough explanation on the topic of {topic}.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases that signal the model to stop producing further output.

max_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output.

top_p.description: Sets probability threshold for more relevant outputs.

temperature.description: Influences the randomness of the model's output.

frequency_penalty.description: Modifies the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases within a single output.

presence_penalty.description: Reduces the likelihood of repeating tokens, promoting novelty in the output.

stream.description: Determines the format for output generation. If set to `true`, the output is generated continuously, allowing for real-time streaming of responses. If set to `false`, the output is delivered in a single JSON file.

ctx_len.description: Sets the maximum input the model can use to generate a response, it varies with the model used.

n_parallel.description: Number of parallel processing units to use.

cpu_threads.description: Determines CPU inference threads, limited by hardware and OS.

engine.description: The engine used to run the model.

message.description: The success or error message displayed when a model is successfully loaded or fails to load.

modelId.description: The unique identifier of the model.

model.description: The unique identifier of the model.

modelPath.description: The file path to the model.

name.description: The display name of the model.

modelHandle.description: The unique identifier of the imported model.

message.description: The response success or error message.

description.example: This extension enables chat completion API calls using the Onnx engine

id.description: The model identifier, which can be referenced in the API endpoints.

prompt_template.example: You are an expert in {subject}. Provide a detailed and thorough explanation on the topic of {topic}.
prompt_template.description: A predefined text or framework that guides the AI model's response generation.

stop.description: Defines specific tokens or phrases that signal the model to stop producing further output.

max_tokens.description: Sets the upper limit on the number of tokens the model can generate in a single output.

temperature.description: Influences the randomness of the model's output.

top_p.description: Sets probability threshold for more relevant outputs

stream.description: Determines the format for output generation. If set to `true`, the output is generated continuously, allowing for real-time streaming of responses. If set to `false`, the output is delivered in a single JSON file.

frequency_penalty.description: Modifies the likelihood of the model repeating the same words or phrases within a single output.

presence_penalty.description: Reduces the likelihood of repeating tokens, promoting novelty in the output.

ctx_len.description: The context length for model operations varies; the maximum depends on the specific model used.

cpu_threads.description: Determines CPU inference threads, limited by hardware and OS.

pre_prompt.description: The prompt to use for internal configuration
pre_prompt.example: You are an assistant with expert knowledge in {subject}. Please provide a detailed and accurate response to the following query: {query}. Ensure that your response is clear, concise, and informative.

n_batch.description: The batch size for prompt eval step

caching_enabled.description: To enable prompt caching or not

mlock.description: Prevent system swapping of the model to disk in macOS

grammar_file.description: You can constrain the sampling using GBNF grammars by providing path to a grammar file

flash_attn.description: To enable Flash Attention, default is true

cache_type.description: KV cache type: f16, q8_0, q4_0, default is f16

use_mmap.description: To enable mmap, default is true

id.description: The identifier of the model that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a model.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the model was successfully deleted.

id.description: The unique identifier of the assistant.

avatar.description: URL of the assistant's avatar image.

model.description: The model's unique identifier and settings.

instructions.example: Assist with customer queries and provide information based on the company database.

description.example: This assistant helps with customer support by retrieving relevant information.

top_p.description: Top-p sampling value for the assistant.

created_at.description: Timestamp of when the assistant was created.

response_format.description: The response format option for the assistant.

assistants.description: The details of the thread's settings.

example.value: How does AI work? Explain it in simple terms.

text.description: Text content of the message along with any annotations.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

content.description: Array of content objects detailing the message content.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread message.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the message.

thread_id.description: Identifier of the thread to which this message belongs.

role.description: Role of the sender, either 'user' or 'assistant'.

file_ids.description: Array of file IDs associated with the message, if any.

assistant_id.description: Identifier of the assistant involved in the message, if applicable.

run_id.description: Run ID associated with the message, if applicable.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a list.

first_id.description: Identifier of the first message in the list.

last_id.description: Identifier of the last message in the list.

has_more.description: Indicates whether there are more messages to retrieve.

role.description:
The role of the entity that is creating the message. Allowed values include:
      - user: Indicates the message is sent by an actual user and should be used in most cases to represent user-generated messages.
      - assistant: Indicates the message is generated by the assistant. Use this value to insert messages from the assistant into the conversation.

content.description: The text contents of the message.

id.description: The identifier of the message that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a message.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the message was successfully deleted.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp representing the creation time of the thread.

assistants.description: List of assistants involved in the thread.

messages.description: List of messages within the thread.

id.description: The identifier of the thread that was deleted.

object.description: Type of the object, indicating it's a thread.

deleted.description: Indicates whether the thread was successfully deleted.
